writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
The morning sun filtered softly through the curtains, casting a warm glow across the room. Will Solace stirred, feeling the familiar weight of Nico di Angelo nestled against him. The scent of fresh coffee drifted from the kitchen, but Will was in no rush. Mornings like these were a treasure—filled with laughter, kisses, and the inevitable battle to leave the cozy confines of their bed.

"Good morning, sunshine," Nico mumbled, his voice still heavy with sleep. Will chuckled, pressing a gentle kiss to Nico's forehead.

"Morning, my little night owl," Will replied, wrapping his arms tighter around Nico. Their mornings were always like this—easy, filled with the kind of warmth that made every day feel like a new adventure.

But today, Nico seemed different. There was a glint in his dark eyes, one that told Will he was about to say something unexpected.

"You know," Nico began, a mischievous smile playing on his lips, "I've been thinking."

"Uh-oh," Will teased, feigning apprehension. "Should I be worried?"

Nico swatted him playfully. "What if we started each morning with a new mythical adventure?"

Will raised an eyebrow. "You mean like storytelling?"

"Not exactly," Nico said, his eyes twinkling with excitement. "I mean, we reenact a different myth every morning. It'd be fun!"

Will laughed, the sound echoing in the quiet room. "You call this a mythological adventure? I call it a mythological mess waiting to happen."

Nico grinned, clearly undeterred. "Come on, it'll be great! Think about it—one day we could be Artemis and Apollo, hunting mythical creatures, and the next, we could be Orpheus and Eurydice, navigating the Underworld."

Will couldn't help but smile at Nico's enthusiasm. "Alright," he said, "I'm in. But only if I get to be the one with the golden lyre."

The following morning, Will awoke to find Nico rifling through their wardrobe, pulling out anything that remotely resembled a toga.

"Today," Nico announced with grandiosity, "we're Zeus and Hera."

Will snorted. "Zeus and Hera? Really? I don't think I have the ego for that."

Nico tossed a pillow at him. "Come on, it'll be fun. You can practice throwing lightning bolts."

With an exaggerated sigh, Will donned a makeshift toga, and they spent the morning battling imaginary titans and hurling invisible lightning. Their laughter filled the room, turning the mundane into something magical.

As the days went by, their new routine took hold. They were Achilles and Patroclus one morning, Demeter and Persephone the next. Their small bedroom became a stage for heroes and gods, and each day brought a new adventure, a new reason to laugh together.

One morning, after a particularly hilarious reenactment of the Trojan War—complete with a stuffed horse as their prop—Will and Nico collapsed onto the bed, breathless with laughter.

"You know," Will said, catching his breath, "this was a good idea."

Nico turned to him, eyes soft and full of affection. "I knew you'd come around."

Will leaned in, capturing Nico's lips in a tender kiss. "Every day is an adventure with you," he murmured against Nico's mouth.

In that moment, amidst the laughter and the playful chaos, Will realized something important. This whimsical routine, this shared fantasy, wasn't just about reenacting myths. It was about creating their own—writing a story filled with love, laughter, and an unbreakable bond that would weather any storm.

And as they lay there, tangled together in the morning light, Will knew they’d found something truly magical in the everyday.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
It was one of those lazy Sunday afternoons at Camp Half-Blood, the kind where time seemed to stretch like taffy. Nico was lounging in the cabin, the golden light of the setting sun spilling across the floorboards. He was scrolling through his phone, half-listening to the music playing softly in the background—some indie band Will liked. His partner, Will, was sprawled next to him, eyes closed, humming along.

"Hey, Will," Nico said, glancing over. "You always say I can look through your phone, right?"

Will cracked one eye open, a lazy smile spreading across his face. "Of course. I have no secrets, my dark prince."

Nico snorted at the nickname, but a warmth spread through him. He reached for Will's phone, half out of curiosity, half out of boredom. Unlocking it, he was met with the usual barrage of notifications and apps. But then he saw the photo gallery app, and something tugged at him—a mix of curiosity and a faint apprehension.

As he opened the gallery, he was greeted by a collection of photos. Most were typical: selfies of the two of them, sunsets over the camp, group shots during capture the flag. But then he stumbled upon a folder titled "Nico Moments."

Curiosity piqued, he opened it. The first photo made him pause. It was of him sitting by the campfire, a gentle smile on his face as he roasted a marshmallow. The firelight danced across his features, casting a warm glow. He didn't even remember Will taking it.

He scrolled to the next one, and the next, each capturing a moment he hadn't realized was special. There he was, laughing with Annabeth during a game of Mythomagic, or lying in the grass with a book, the sunlight catching his hair just right. There was even one of him asleep, face smushed against a pillow, looking utterly peaceful.

A laugh bubbled up, unexpected and bright. "Will, am I your secret model or something?" he teased, nudging his partner.

Will opened his eyes, looking amused. "Caught me," he said, sitting up. "I guess you're my muse now."

Nico shook his head, a smile playing on his lips. "I never realized how much you notice the little things about me," he admitted, a touch of awe in his voice.

Will shrugged, leaning in to rest his head on Nico's shoulder. "I just love seeing you in those moments when you're truly yourself," he said softly. "It’s like having tiny windows into our shared world."

A comfortable silence settled between them, the music in the background weaving a gentle cocoon around them. Nico scrolled through more photos, each one a testament to the life they'd built together, the love they shared.

"Hey, remember this one?" Nico pointed to a particularly silly candid where he was caught mid-yawn, looking like a sleepy cat. "You have a knack for catching me at my best."

Will chuckled, pressing a kiss to Nico's temple. "You're always at your best to me," he murmured.

Nico felt his heart swell, the photos now a treasure trove of memories he hadn't known he cherished. He turned to Will, eyes bright with affection. "Thank you for seeing me," he said, voice thick with emotion.

Will's gaze was warm and steady. "Always, Nico. Always."

In that moment, surrounded by the cozy familiarity of their home and the whimsical magic of their captured moments, Nico knew he was exactly where he was meant to be.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
“Come on, Nico, it’s just a video,” Will urged, waving a fluffy makeup brush like a wand. “Think of it as a quest. You loved those.”

Nico frowned from his seat in their cluttered living room-turned-makeup studio. “I’m not sure about this. I’m the son of Hades, not Aphrodite. I don’t do makeup.”

Will grinned, already setting up his camera. “Well, today you’re my muse. This will be fun, I promise. Plus, it’s for charity. And you’ve survived Tartarus, so a little foundation won’t kill you.”

Nico sighed, relenting with a soft chuckle. “Alright, fine. But if you turn me into a clown, I’m summoning skeletons to help me escape.”

“Deal,” Will laughed, leaning down to peck Nico’s cheek. The touch was a grounding reminder of how much he loved this sunshine boy.

Will started with primer, chatting away about his day at the hospital, the mundane turned magical under his touch. “You won’t even recognize yourself,” he said, dabbing concealer.

“I’m counting on it,” Nico replied, trying to keep still. His internal monologue was a mix of disbelief and curiosity. He trusted Will, but he also knew the mischief that danced in his eyes like sunlight on a summer morning.

As Will worked, Nico closed his eyes, focusing on the feel of the brushes, the gentle strokes like whispers across his skin. It was oddly soothing, almost meditative. The quiet hum of their apartment enveloped them, the domesticity of it all grounding.

“Almost done,” Will said, stepping back to admire his handiwork. “Ready to see?”

Nico opened his eyes, blinking at the sudden brightness. Will handed him a mirror, looking expectant and slightly nervous.

Nico hesitated before taking a look. What he saw made him burst into laughter. “Is that…?”

“Zeus,” Will confirmed, barely containing his own laughter. “You’re Zeus, complete with thunderbolts and all.”

Nico’s reflection was a sight to behold. Will had somehow managed to make him look regal and ridiculous at the same time, with shimmering blue and silver makeup creating an electric effect around his eyes. A fake beard, made of what looked like cotton balls, completed the transformation.

“You’re lucky I’m your partner,” Nico said, still chuckling. “I look like a cross between a storm and a cotton candy machine.”

Will shrugged, a playful glint in his eyes. “I think you look godly. Besides, it’s for a good cause, and your reaction was priceless.”

Nico set the mirror down, grabbing Will by the front of his shirt and pulling him in for a kiss. “You’re impossible, you know that?”

“And you love me for it,” Will replied, grinning against Nico’s lips.

“Yeah, I do,” Nico admitted, his heart full. They stood there, wrapped up in each other, surrounded by the remnants of their playful chaos.

“Hey, let’s take a picture before you wash it off,” Will suggested, reaching for his phone.

“Fine, but only if I get to do your makeup next,” Nico retorted, grinning.

Will laughed, pulling Nico closer as they posed together, capturing the moment in the glow of their shared laughter and love.
